website_summaries.verdict: From flower beds to small vegetable gardens, this little gas tiller is worth a look for gardening enthusiasts who need an easy-to-maneuver model.
pros: Lightweight, compact design is built for small gardens and landscaping tasks
A good choice for users with limited strength
cons: Somewhat pricey for such a compact model

website_summaries.verdict: 2-stroke gas tiller has FastStart motor, and can power through soil beds independent of a power source.
pros: FastStart technology offers 75% better starting experience
Lightweight, 21 pound tiller folds down for easy storage and transport
Tine depth can dig between 2 and 10 inches, depending on settings
cons: Some users have difficulty starting, despite the FastStart motor
Other users have difficulty breaking into denser soil beds

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS REALLY A GREAT MACHINE. IT TEARS THROUGH THE SOIL AND WONT ...
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS REALLY A GREAT MACHINE . IT TEARS THROUGH THE SOIL AND WONT QUIT GRINDING ... HOWEVER I BOUGHT THE EASY START MODEL AS I AM UP IN YEARS NOW . AND WHILE IT PULLS VERY EASILY, IT TAKES WHEN COLD 10 TO 15 PULLS TO GET IT TO FIRST START UP ... AFTER IT WARMS UP IT STARTS UP REALLY FAST.....DO NOT LET THAT STOP YOU FROM BUYING STILL A GREAT LITTLE MACHINE ..
customer_reviews.author: SETHDOUG

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing performance
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this tiller to answer my needs but it's great powerful engine, but did not break ground as advertised. Tiller works great on composted soil but was unable to break into hard ground. If you hit any kind of rock, look out, it jumped into the air uncontrollably.
customer_reviews.author: malefic

customer_reviews.title: Get the Kickstand too.
customer_reviews.text: Great tiller at a reasonable price. Have used one in the past without the kickstand and wouldn't buy another one unless it came with it. Makes storing and running it way easier.
customer_reviews.author: WPG

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine.
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to assemble. Had easy instructions. Started right away. This is the second one I have owned. The first one lasted over 7 years. AND It can still be fixed if needed. I flipped the tines for cultivate and used on my lawn to reguvinate and reseed. I cultivated organic matter and Peet Moss into the soil of just over an acre. Finished in a couple of hours. The mantis work hard and just had to retighten some bolts. The fast start feature is great as my wife was able to start with one easy pull (you don't have to pull quickly or sharply).
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: tiller/cultivator
customer_reviews.text: Mantis cultivator / tiller was easy to put together and easy to use, also light weight, glad I heard about this product
customer_reviews.author: Millie Leipertz

customer_reviews.title: unreal power
customer_reviews.text: Holy smokes! Amazing power from a small package. Chewing through the clay soil in our garden without breaking a sweat. LOVE the easy start. Now I want all my 2 cycle gear to have that.
customer_reviews.author: Pirate John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is tough!! I bought this when my troy built cultivator crapped out on me. I loves that machine, had it for 10 years! But then this arrived! The mantis tiller has the easy start, it's awesome! No more tired arm from pulling and pulling to start. Starts great, runs fast, and tills like crazy! I use it to turn over compost piles, and to till my garden up. I use a big tiller to turn the ground, and follow up with the mantis to make the dirt really fine and easy to plant in! I'd definitely buy this again, and will recommend to anyone that is looking for one!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: I love this tiller
customer_reviews.text: I love this tiller. It is small light weight so if you hit big roots it will jump but over all for the size this son of a gun will dig a hole to china. I love love love it. Starting is for the most part very easy, if you pull one time and it doesn't seem to want to start pull out choke pull cord a time or two push choke back in and pull and starts right up. i have used this tiller so far for three projects and have had no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: michael f. cole

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great. Tough to use on ground that has never ...
customer_reviews.text: Believe all the positive reviews. This thing is great. Tough to use on ground that has never been turned over, but great if it has. Wait for a day after a good rain and even the toughest of undisturbed clay will be eaten by this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: tcurrin

customer_reviews.title: Replacement
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaced a thirty year old Mantis that was still working. I gave the old one to a friend. Love the easy start procedure on the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: A real workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved my first Mantis cultivator. I used it weekly to weed between the rows of my vegetable garden. It ran flawlessly for several years, until I failed to properly prep it for storage. It failed to start this season, so I purchased a new one. This time I opted for the "Plus" with the spring-assisted starter. It may sound like a gimmick but it truly works as advertised. I will be using ethanol-free TruFuel from now on so I expect this will be the last Mantis I will ever purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Z.

customer_reviews.title: I loved my prior Mantis tiller for 20 years until the ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved my prior Mantis tiller for 20 years until the mice ate up the wiring and gas tank. Bought the new one this year, only problem I have is the new one likes to flood easily, if it weren't for that it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: But it was easy. The vacuum cleaner motion is taking some practice ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure I could start a tiller. But it was easy. The vacuum cleaner motion is taking some practice but I think by the end of the growing season I'll have it mastered. The weight is a big plus. So light I can carry it to my garden. The first time I used it it worked up my garden about 8 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Jeffers

customer_reviews.title: Bam! Garden beds tilled in no time at all!
customer_reviews.text: Zoom! Garden was tilled in no time. I used my neighbor's Mantis a long time ago and wanted one since. It is light, POWERFUL and tore the clay up like butter. I am sorry I waited so long to get my own. (Seriously, now I understand why people say that corny line.)
customer_reviews.author: Handygal

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller for the money
customer_reviews.text: The key to an easy start is to choke it only for the first pull, then push the choke back in to the run position for second pull. Excellent weeder for my garden and excavates deeply and quickly as you pull it backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: It is best to use 89 octane/alcohol free gas and the Mantis 2 cycle oil for best running results.
customer_reviews.text: tiller works just like described. very easy to start-hardly no effort at all. I would recommend this Mantis Tiller to anyone, especially if they have injured shoulders or elbows.
customer_reviews.author: older&smarter

customer_reviews.title: Easy where worked before
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a ton in my 60 x 30 garden. Easy where worked before, hard work to remove grass where I expanded the garden. WELL WORTH the money i m o .
customer_reviews.author: David McCracken

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband who is an avid gardener. He absolutely loves it! It's light-weight, easy-to-start and he particularly likes the kick-stand feature.
customer_reviews.author: jewelryjunkie

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to trouble shoot
customer_reviews.text: After unboxing ane assembling took it out side to fire it up and had no throttle so i figured out the throttle cable was not hooked up, then the tines did not turn. Had to remove axle and the worm gear was installed incorrectly after fixing these problems it worked, but what a pain in the ass
customer_reviews.author: travis

customer_reviews.title: I would like to contact the seller cause I need some broken parts to be replace.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product very much cause it works really good. Actually this is the second Mantis cultivator I own. The first one lasted for ten years. The only problem I have now is I broke the carrying handle just this week. I was surprise cause my old cultivator for ten years of work never get broke. I hope the seller will replace it cause its still under warranty. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: vic lacsa

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a good product. I am able to start it most of the times. Pull is a little hard. It is a little hard to maneuver if the ground is a little compact. It would be nice if it had wheels like my other cultivator did as I think it makes it easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Betty R.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, great value
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to use, more powerful than I thought it would be. It was simple to put together, and is truly a quality unit. I've got a 25 x25 ft. garden, and it takes care of all its needs. I purchased the plow unit to make rows even easier. Buy thidS tiller, you'll be quite happy. If you're starting a new garden from sod, yes, rent a big one, then you'll be all set.
customer_reviews.author: Baker

customer_reviews.title: Many improvements compared to the older models.
customer_reviews.text: Great improvements The handles are padded now. The kick stand is a great addition and the easy start pull cord is so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Hale

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our garden
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was interesting with my hubs and me ;) No acorn nuts included in the packaging, but no biggie. It's perfect for the garden because it's so much smaller and more maneuverable than the big tillar. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the secon or third one I have owned ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the secon or third one I have owned over the years - works really well in my raised beds.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey H Smith

customer_reviews.title: EASY to Start
customer_reviews.text: It starts easy enough a lady can pull start it with ease. It has a wind up spring that releases and start with very little effort. I recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Donald K.

customer_reviews.title: It does what is claimed!
customer_reviews.text: This model is quite an improvement over previous ones. The kickstand and easy start make it easy to get working quickly. I use it mostly in raised beds and for tight weeding when there is little space for the bigger tillers. No more pulling on an precariously balanced tiller that was awkward at best and much more difficult to start. Why did it take you so long to come up with this model?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement over my 30 year old model
customer_reviews.text: They have continuously improved on a well tested design. Really does start easily if you just follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Red Vette

customer_reviews.title: aweful
customer_reviews.text: it should be a federal crime for mantis to sell these tillers with their motors on them.........aweful motor....... cant start them........ and if they start they wont run. ive never been more dissapointed in my life. buy the honda motor
customer_reviews.author: stacy hoggard

customer_reviews.title: Quality hardware
customer_reviews.text: Does well with dirt. Rocks in the dirt not so much. Easy starting reliable and you can till up that garden fast
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: great machine.
customer_reviews.text: it has a recoil start which is great for an old man. only complaint is they have done away with the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: denis

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement to a classic machine.
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a nice update to the previous Mantis I had used for over 20 years. The kick stand is a great feature. It is essentially the same machine I enjoyed in the past with the easy start a big plus and new styled handles that make using it less tiring.
customer_reviews.author: Old D

customer_reviews.title: tough to start and keep running
customer_reviews.text: This machine is great for small areas once it starts and stays running. I found it very difficult to start it the first time . I just went to start it 5 months later it started but would not keep running I heard great comments about this machine BUT I am not overly impressed with mine Sorry I was hoping for better results
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Great little tiller, lightweight, easy to handle and powerful. Perfect home gardening aid. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Starboy98

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly. No regrets.
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor bought one about 20 years ago. I used his until he moved. I'm glad I bought this one instead of a cheaper version. It starts right up, chills like a champ, and just keeps going. It's perfect for a small garden.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a little tough to start up, compared to the 4 cycle unit, but it runs faster and stronger. I am hoping the Echo engine used will be as good as all my other Echo engines, which last a long time and run well.
customer_reviews.author: mansfieldGardener

customer_reviews.title: excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: I had a Mantis that I loved, let a friend borrow it and you know the rest. I bought a similar tool at one of the big box home improvement stores and took it back within two days. I finally did what I should have done and ordered this Mantis. Best move I made!
customer_reviews.author: R. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Easy start and very maneuverable.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a light weight tiller for narrow rows in garden. Starts wonderful and does a wonderful job. I had a mantis tiller years ago and that is the reason I purchased this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazodennis wickstromn Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Had ine 20 yrs ago. Moved to a small lot and didn’t need it. Now on a large lot and repurchased the upgrade. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn C

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: Works great for cultivating between garden rows and tilling up smaller raised bed areas . Just wish there was some way to avoid wedging rocks between the tines and guard .
customer_reviews.author: Robert Carbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly went smoothly, instructions easy to follow, actually had all necessary parts. Runs great so far. I have health issues which have degraded my ability to work. Yet with this I am looking forward to completing chores.
customer_reviews.author: Retired lifer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice machine, my husband tilled the raised veggie garden ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice machine, my husband tilled the raised veggie garden and absolutely loved it. Not hard to use, not too heavy and it does a great job of tilling
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne R

customer_reviews.title: Good luck getting it serviced warranty
customer_reviews.text: used it once last year. stored it properly as suggested. went to go use it now to plant and the thing won’t stay running. will start but it will not stay running. Having quite an ordeal trying to get it serviced and the warranty honored.
customer_reviews.author: Jane E. Ouzts

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: very handy tool for the garden. It will give you a work out for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan

customer_reviews.title: How it handles and what it is capable of.
customer_reviews.text: It is handy in that it is small and light however, it does "jump" a lot when the ground is a bit hard and, it there are any weeds to till up in the garden they tend to clog up the tines on the tiller. I am not real impressed with the performance as a whole
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: The best tiller I've ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I love the (light) weight and maneuverability of this tiller. The fast-start technology is amazing. I have shoulder issues and not having to pull as hard as most two-strokes engines makes this the perfect tool for the garden.
customer_reviews.author: timreb

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my use, well made, easy instructions and assembly.
customer_reviews.author: tina culp

customer_reviews.title: Continues the quality of Mantis
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my previous Mantis after almost 23 yrs and this one is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: JimS

customer_reviews.title: Always wanted a mantis
customer_reviews.text: Nice machine, maneuvers well. Cuts through a flower bed in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Riley

customer_reviews.title: Engine won't start after third use
customer_reviews.text: The 2 cycle engine worked fine for the first use. Second use, it would only run when the throttle was applied. It would cut off if idled for more than four or five seconds. Third use, it won't start at all. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: A real time saver
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tiller. It starts easy and makes light tilling/weeding our garden a breeze. The reversible tines are handy, I found they are too aggressive in the “tilling” position so I turned them around and it works great
customer_reviews.author: Chris F

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good so far
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good so far. I've only had it a week or so and haven't put it to a big test yet, but so far it seems to be just what I needed for my flower beds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small yet powerful. Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Can bust up any soil. Great to dig planting holes too!
customer_reviews.author: Gary D

customer_reviews.title: Great Tiller
customer_reviews.text: I am getting to old to start my old mantis. This tiller is so easy to start.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Libengood

customer_reviews.title: Garden tiller MAGIC
customer_reviews.text: Easily assemble and ready to go to work. What a great tool for raise garden beds. Its light weight and easy to start engine made tilling my raised garden beds a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Did the job very well
customer_reviews.text: Was very impress.with me being a woman I was able to put it together and I did my whole vegetable garden ,plus my flowerbeds.Easy to use and handle with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to move and does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything but how muck it bounces around especially when you come in contact with a rock. I also don’t like when a rock gets caught in the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Tari

customer_reviews.title: I have wasted money all these years at HD and Lowes buying ...
customer_reviews.text: I typically do not write these, but I felt compelled. I have wasted money all these years at HD and Lowes buying Ryobi, Troy-bilt, and Homelite. I have always wondered about the Mantis. I have seen people use them and never wanted to spend the money. This baby tears up the soil. Even hard packed Georgia red clay. I hope it lasts for a long time. Update 1/21/18- Not even 1 year old and all of the fuel lines have deteriorated and need to be replaced. The carb is leaking gas through the seals.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Never started.  Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I give this a one star because I opened the box, I followed the instructions, I bought a 1 gallon gas can, put the 50/1 mix into 87 ethanol free gas and pumped the prime 5x put it to the “-“ and pulled the starter 20x. Then followed all the instructions to trouble shoot. I removed the spark plug etc. I called amazon and UPS is going to pick it up on Monday. Amazon told me that we will not get credit until they get the product back. Both my husband and I are prime members and by far this was the worse customer experience we have had to date. Buyer beware of this crappy product.
customer_reviews.author: Lori M.

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Small but mighty and super easy to use 🙌🏼🙌🏼
customer_reviews.author: Adria Hansche

customer_reviews.title: Marginal operation
customer_reviews.text: At first 1 liked this rototiller. However, after a few weeks, it has become impossible to start. Looks like something has happened to whatever provides ignition to the spark plug.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Starts good-- Better than 1st Mantis & it was 25yrs old
customer_reviews.text: Tills just as good or even better than 1st Mantis that died a Slow Death!!
customer_reviews.author: Rodney White

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mantis Tiller
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! It tears up my crappy Texas soil with no issues! My first use was to "dig" out a hole to plant some trees. Made quick short work of it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hobby Farmer

customer_reviews.title: It's a great little tiller!
customer_reviews.text: light weight, easy to use and does a great Job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a replacement for a Mantis that I had ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a Mantis that I had for about 15 years. I gave that one to a friend because it needed some work. He fixed it and is still using it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dabolt

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time around!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. Had one for many years that bit the dust! Hopefully, this one is even better!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy start . Easy to clean tines. Thanks would recommended product
customer_reviews.author: Rick Mann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This tiller starts easily and has a lot of power
customer_reviews.author: skyelily

customer_reviews.title: Starts EASY!
customer_reviews.text: Works great - pretty aggressive on the soil! Would be nice to have the wheels though. Maybe later😏
customer_reviews.author: geri

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the
customer_reviews.text: This thing will dig to China and back. Easy on the back
customer_reviews.author: Larry Fowler

customer_reviews.title: The tiller starts easy and once it's warmed up tackled all my needs ...
customer_reviews.text: The tiller starts easy and once it's warmed up tackled all my needs during my ongoing backyard landscaping upgrades. The ease in use and cleaning makes this one of the best garden tools in my shed.
customer_reviews.author: Rick G.

customer_reviews.title: Wont start
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good if you can get it started.First time I used it it started very easily. Four days later it would not start. I have not had time to try again. One of the worst buys I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: J&K Antiques

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and does a great
customer_reviews.text: this tiller is light,easy to use and does a great job
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Schuermann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This perfect for our garden and flower beds. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Brieden

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job to be so small and light.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Found it easy to use and does a great job tilling the soil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Mantis 7924 Fast Start Tiller
product_meta.description: The secret to growing vegetables & flowers is great soil. The Mantis 2-cycle Plus tiller/cultivator with FastStart technology quickly breaks up the dirt & hard clay soil fast & preps it for planting. This mini-tiller starts 75% easier. Compact 9" Width rototills & digs in large or narrow spaces. Versatile tines flip around to weed & cultivate around plants. An innovative transmission & engine-over-tine design makes this lightweight, small tiller deliver heavyweight performance. Fingertip throttle control with infinite speeds. Comfortable Sure-Grip handles are easy on hands. Folding handles make it convenient to store. Built for durability & deniability. Makes digging, rototilling & weeding fast, easy & fun.
feature_bullets: 21. 2cc gas 2-cycle commercial engine turns tines twice as fast as other Small tillers
Fast-start technology makes pulling the starter cord 75% easier
Weighs Only 21 pounds for easy lifting and transport to garden
9" Wide for digging and weeding in any size yard or garden and along fences or between plants
Tines dig down to 10" Deep and around to cultivate or gently weed 2-3" Deep and Tine speed is up to 240 RPM

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars157 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
